key_channel_insights.line_content: 95% of Frontier itineraries price higher on OTAs, yet the average markup is only +0.29%, underscoring a pervasive—but correctable—parity gap.
True parity has climbed to 19%, but 28% of itineraries are now cheaper on metasearch, risking revenue leakage despite deltas of just −0.16%.
GDS displays a 95% premium rate, and a 34% offer-not-found rate for non-US origins exposes a critical weakness in international distribution.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 95% of fares list higher on OTAs, averaging a +0.29% markup and leaving virtually no price parity.
OTA-higher share slipped 1.1 ppts MoM while OTA-lower cases nearly doubled, hinting at nascent correction.
6.5% of long-haul fares are missing on OTAs—double the system rate—suppressing international demand.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Coverage improved 12% WoW but remains 40% above last month’s level.
Still dominant; share eased 0.2 ppts WoW and 1.1 ppts MoM.
Discounted cases up 52% WoW, yet average undercut is just −0.20%.
True price matches are virtually nonexistent across the network.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 96.4% higher on OTAs with a +0.30% markup; minimal 2.5% content gap.
91.5% higher, but missing-fare rate peaks at 6.5%; OTA-lower share doubled WoW.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 96.4% higher on OTAs; missing content only 2.4% with +0.29% premium.
18.8% of fares missing; only 78.6% price higher and markup softens to +0.24%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 94.7% higher on OTAs (+0.26%); highest missing-fare rate at 4.6%.
96.1% higher with a steeper +0.34% premium; OTA-lower share 2.4× WoW.

mse_highlights.line_content: Share of MSE-higher itineraries fell ~31% WoW to 53%, reflecting effective parity actions.
MSE-lower cases climbed to 28% (+16% WoW), threatening brand trust despite small deltas.
Average difference stays within ±0.3%, making perception—not economics—the key issue.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Up 15% WoW but still below the 40–50% industry benchmark.
Still majority but down 31% WoW; premium now +0.26%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Higher-fare share dropped to 51% (−33% WoW); lower-fare share up to 30%.
58% higher on MSE; undercuts limited to 22%, needing focus.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Higher-fare frequency down to 52%; parity matches network average at 19%.
65% higher and 34.5% missing, largest gap across segments.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Higher-fare cases down to 51%; undercuts at 30% with −0.15% delta.
58% higher with widest +0.32% premium despite 37% WoW improvement.

gds_highlights.line_content: 95.3% higher on GDS with a modest +0.28% markup.
34.5% of non-US origin itineraries not found, versus 1.5% for US.
GDS-higher share for near-departure searches jumped 3.2 ppts WoW to 94.5%.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Flat WoW, down 0.5 ppt MoM but still material in select markets.
Up 1.9 ppts WoW; markup steady at +0.28%.
Cheaper fares nearly disappeared (−1.5 ppts WoW).
Exact matches essentially absent, highlighting structural mis-alignment.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 90.6% higher but 7.6% not-found, combining price and visibility concerns.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Only 62.9% higher, yet 34.5% missing—a critical exposure abroad.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 96.9% higher with the largest +0.35% premium; missing content low at 1.3%.
